tldr: The author investigates a subsidence event near Folkstone, on the coast of Kent, where part of the cliff west of the town sank into the earth, causing the ground to rise in an extraordinary manner. The author, John Lyon, provides an accurate drawing and an explanatory letter, analyzing the cause of the sinking ground as being undermined by water through a stratum of loose marle, which forms channels over time. This phenomenon raises concerns about the stability of the coast and the potential for greater changes in the landscape.
